basics.name: Quinne Uchida
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2020.

work.company: University of Hawaii Department of Information Computer Science IT Help Desk
work.summary: Student assitant to full time employees
highlights: Creating new User accounts every semester using Active Directory, Powershell scripts and Windows Batch files.
Deploy software to computer lab machines using PDQ deploy.
Creating an OS image and deploying OS image over a domain.
Configuiring a network consisting of at the minimum: a switch, 6 vlans, a firewall and an access point.
Managing a switch through SSH, console connection and Telnet connection.
Securely erasing sensitive information on hard drives.
Assisted members of the ICS department with various troubleshooting tasks.

work.summary: Prepared displays of clothing items using a combination of personal styling choices and corporate instructions
highlights: In charge of finding and processing markdown merchandise
Assembled completed clothing looks to market to customers that consisted of at the minimum: a top, a bottom, a layering piece, an accessory and shoes

awards.title: INBRE Student Research Grant
awards.Summary: $1,000 dollars per semester of participation awarded to an approved INBRE research project.

awards.title: Kapiolani Opportunity Grant
awards.summary: Monetary award for achieving a cumulative GPA of 3.5 or above.

awards.title: FRC Regional Finalist
awards.summary: Award for the runner up of the First Hawaii Robotics Regional Competition.

awards.title: Purple Gold Medal Solo and Ensemble
awards.summary: Performed the first movement of the Lalo Cello Concerto to a panel of judges.
